document_data.name: Yuan-ti pit master
document_data.distinctions:
Humanoid body
Snakes in place of arms
document_data.mainbody: '''Yuan-ti pit masters''' were cautious [[yuan-ti malison]] priests of the deity [[Merrshaulk]].
document_data.Description: Yuan-ti pit masters were mostly humanoid in form, but had many snake-body-like tentacles in place of arms.
document_data.Personality: Pit masters were traditionalists who always preferred a slow, cautious approach in any matter and opposed any reckless behavior. They felt that they were the most capable of achieving the goals of the yuan-ti.
document_data.Abilities:
{{Quote|I've met a few [[yuan-ti pureblood|purebloods]] and [[yuan-ti broodguard|broodguards]] in my day, but had I met a yuan-ti pit master, I'm quite sure I'd not be here to tell the tale!|[[Volothamp Geddarm|Volos']] notes in ''[[Volo's Guide to Monsters (in-universe)|Volo's Guide to Monsters]]''.}}
Like other yuan-ti, pit masters were immune to poison and resistant to spells and other magical effects. They could turn into a snake and back at will. Pit masters could also innately cast the spells ''[[animal friendship]]'' at will and ''[[suggestion]]'' thrice each day.

As priests of Merrshaulk, yuan-ti pit masters knew the cantrips ''[[eldritch blast]]'', ''[[friends]]'', ''[[guidance]]'', ''[[mage hand]]'', ''[[message]]'', and ''[[poison spray]]'', and the spells ''[[command]]'', ''[[counterspell]]'', ''[[hellish rebuke]]'', ''[[invisibility]]'', ''[[misty step]]'', ''[[unseen servant]]'', and ''[[vampiric touch]]''. They could only cast two spells each day, however.

Additionally, once each day a pit master could cause five creatures within {{SI|60|ft|long=yes}} of it that it could see to collapse into a magical sleep for 10 minutes.
document_data.Combat: Pit masters did not use weapons or armor, instead relying on their naturally venomous fangs to deal with enemies.
document_data.Society: Yuan-ti pit masters were priests of the ancient yuan-ti god Merrshaulk, and they sacrificed humanoids to him in order to rouse him from his slumber. They were also heavily involved in the long-term plans of the yuan-ti to take over humanoid governments and also in the efforts to protect their own cities from discovery and attack.
